result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert G Fitzpatrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 140 days served.
Consecutive to: Jackson County Cases 15CF67, 15CM83, 15CM118, 15CM121

superMiscConds.notes: Pursuant to Wis. Stat 973.05(4)(b), restitution, costs, and surcharges are to be paid from all prison funds, not to exceed 25% of gross.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant must submit to random PBT's by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant must submit to random urinalysis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  No contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses or their property:  Jesse Honaker, Kristy Honaker, Mary Fisher, Jason Ott, Greg Simplot, Sandra Smith, Josh Hoffman, Wal-Mart, Black River Country Bank, Kwik Trip, or any other victims and their property in this case.

Must comply with any DOC recommendations for AODA or mental health needs.  Defendant must execute all releases of information for assessments, counseling, treatment, to allow probation agent to verify compliance.  

Must comply with any other recommendations of your agent.

Pursuant to Wis. Stat 973.05(4)(b), restitution, costs, and surcharges are to be paid from all prison funds, not to exceed 25% of gross.  Restitution amounts in this case are read-ins from Jackson County case 15CF170.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Restitution worksheet
VNR for Acuity - this should be on case 15CF67 which I did a corrected form and mailed it on 5-4-16.
3 victims (mailed out with cards)

Defendant appears in custody from JASO with attorney Gina Bosben present.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  State has properly notifed the victims in all of the cases.  Restitution of several checks were not charged will be read-in for restitution purposes.  That information in detail was stated on the record.  PSI and alternate PSI have been reviewed by the Court.  State has no factual corrections.  Defense has one factual change that his sister, J.F. state she did not tell him to leave after living with her for 4 months.  J.F. is present and states he has never lived with her.  Judge questions Agent Miles present in the courtroom regarding this.  No other corrections noted.  State gives sentencing recommendations on all cases; states probation is not appropriate in these cases.  Judge requests Agent Miles to make statement regarding recommendations in PSI.  Both ADA Inlow and attorney Bosben question Agent Miles.  Defense counsel states her recommendation for sentencing is probation and jail as noted by DOC in PSI and elaborates; requests half-priced IID be ordered on 15CM121.  Defendant excercises his right to allocution and reads a statement.  

15CM121 - Sentence:  $600 fine + costs and may set up a payment plan when out on extended supervision, 65 days jail, 24 mos. DL revocation, 24 mos. IID and Court finds he's indigent and is eligible for reduced costs on IID at time of application, credit for 1 day served.  Concurrent to 15CF67, 15CF218, 15CM118, and 15CM83.

15CF67, Ct 1 - sentenced to 10 years bifurcated 5 yrs. confinement and 5 yrs ES; Ct 2 & 3 - sentenced to 5 years bifurcated 3 years confinement and 2 years ES, both counts concurrent with Count 1, restitution ordered of $4108.34 to Acuity Insurance, credit for 50 days served, must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, costs.  

15CM118 - sentenced to 9 months jail with credit for 1 day jail, concurrent to 15CF67, 15CM121, 15CM83, 15CF218, costs.  

15CM83 - 9 months jail concurrent to 15CM121, 15CF67, 15CM118 and 15CF218 plus costs.

15CF218, Ct 2 -  sentenced to 2 years bifurcated 1 year incarceration and 1 year ES with credit for 140 days served, to be consecutive to 15CF67, 15CM83, 15CM118, 15CM121, restitution ordered to Wal-Mart for $25.94 and restitution ordered as read-in from 15CF170 for $335.00 to Black River Country Bank, $350.00 to Kwik Trip, $40.00 to Full Moon Saloon, and costs.

Extended supervision conditions - No contact of any kind unless approved by agent with the following people:  Jesse or Kristy Honaker, Jason Ott, Greg Simplot, Mary Fisher, Sandra Smith, and Josh Hoffman.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Defendant must submit to random urinalysis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  No association with any known illegal drug dealers or users.  No contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with any of the victims in the cases or their property.  Must comply with all recommendations of DOC for any AODA or mental health needs.  

Court finds not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Court orders restitution is to be paid from all prison funds, not to exceed 25% of gross.  Costs and surchages ordered on all cases as applicable.  Jail credit was ordered as specified in the letter filed by attorney Bosben today.  Felony warning given.
From attorney Gina Bosben to Judge regardin jail credit (with attachment from jail)

Agent T.M. appeared with Attorney Peter Renk.   Attorney Bosben appeared by telephone.  Attorney Melissa Inlow appeared and Attorney William Poss appeared from the state public defender's office.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  OTSC for agent's failure to appear at sentencing and why supplemental PSI was not prepared.  Attorney Renk spoke.  Attorney Renk called agent T.M., sworn by the clerk.  Questioned by Attorney Renk.  T.M. testified.  Attorney Inlow had no questions.  Attorney Bosben made a statement and wants the agent present at the sentencing, or a letter regarding her recommendation and if the new conviction would change her recommendation.  Agent T.M. has the sentencing date and will attend.  Court made statement.  Agent's supervisors are also present.  Can testify if court desires.  Attorney Poss takes no position on the OTSC.  Attorney Poss made statement concerning due process and the financial aspects.  G.J. regional chief community corrections explained DOC's stance.  Will include misdemeanors if on the same order as the felony, as a courtesy.  Attorney Poss restated his concerns regarding due process.  Why was court order not followed for agent to appear?  Attorney Renk explained.  Court is not finding Agent T.M. in contempt.  OTSC dismissed.
Sentencing hearing on April 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Order to show cause hearing on April 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Bosben.  A supplemental PSI was requested, but DOC did not prepare one.  No one in the court system was told it was not going to be done.  PSI writer was ordered to appear, and did not appear.  Inaccurate and not fair to the defendant or the state.  May be additional inaccurate information in the "corrected" PSI.  Missing information on page 1.  Attorney Bosben also concerned.  Jail credit not included.  Defendant wishes to proceed today.  State made a record of his concerns.  OTSC will be drafted for willfully failing to comply with the court's order.   DOC must provide supplemental PSI and appear for the sentencing hearing.  Attorney Bosben may appear by telephone for the contempt hearing on 4/15/16 at 11:00 am.  Sentencing hearing 4/29/16 at 9:30 am.  1 - 1/2 hour block.
Sentencing hearing at 04-05-2016 02:00 pm
Reading of information waived.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Bosben.  Victim notification complied with, per State.  Defendant plead no contest to count 2.  Counts 1 and 3 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge he plead to.  Priors confirmed by the court.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Count 2 as charged.  Sentencing to be set.
Restitution worksheet.

Arraignment at 02-26-2016 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-26-2016 01:30 pm.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver.  Defendant stated that he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to preliminary hearing.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Bosben.  Set 2/26/16 at 1:30 pm.   ARGN, plea/sentencing.

Pre-trial conference at 01-12-2016 10:00 am.
Status conference at 01-25-2016 03:00 pm.
Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant waived the time limits for holding the preliminary hearing.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties in the complaint.  Defendant understood.  Court is aware that the defendant has not cooperated with DOC in preparing the PSI in his other cases.  Court ordered the defendant to cooperate and meet with the agent upon request.  Cash bond set.  Defendant has contact SPD office and says that Attorney Bosben will be appointed.
Adjourned initial appearance at 12-21-2015 09:30 am
